verses.name: Amos 7:1
verses.text: Thus hath the Lord God shewed unto me; and, behold, he formed grasshoppers in the beginning of the shooting up of the latter growth; and, lo, it was the latter growth after the king’s mowings.

verses.name: Amos 7:2
verses.text: And it came to pass, that when they had made an end of eating the grass of the land, then I said, O Lord God, forgive, I beseech thee: by whom shall Jacob arise? for he is small.

verses.name: Amos 7:3
verses.text: The Lord repented for this: It shall not be, saith the Lord.

verses.name: Amos 7:4
verses.text: Thus hath the Lord God shewed unto me: and, behold, the Lord God called to contend by fire, and it devoured the great deep, and did eat up a part.

verses.name: Amos 7:5
verses.text: Then said I, O Lord God, cease, I beseech thee: by whom shall Jacob arise? for he is small.

verses.name: Amos 7:6
verses.text: The Lord repented for this: This also shall not be, saith the Lord God.

verses.name: Amos 7:7
verses.text: Thus he shewed me: and, behold, the Lord stood upon a wall made by a plumbline, with a plumbline in his hand.

verses.name: Amos 7:8
verses.text: And the Lord said unto me, Amos, what seest thou? And I said, A plumbline. Then said the Lord, Behold, I will set a plumbline in the midst of my people Israel: I will not again pass by them any more:

verses.name: Amos 7:9
verses.text: And the high places of Isaac shall be desolate, and the sanctuaries of Israel shall be laid waste; and I will rise against the house of Jeroboam with the sword.

verses.name: Amos 7:10
verses.text: Then Amaziah the priest of Beth–el sent to Jeroboam king of Israel, saying, Amos hath conspired against thee in the midst of the house of Israel: the land is not able to bear all his words.

verses.name: Amos 7:11
verses.text: For thus Amos saith, Jeroboam shall die by the sword, and Israel shall surely be led away captive out of their own land.

verses.name: Amos 7:12
verses.text: Also Amaziah said unto Amos, O thou seer, go, flee thee away into the land of Judah, and there eat bread, and prophesy there:

verses.name: Amos 7:13
verses.text: But prophesy not again any more at Beth–el: for it is the king’s chapel, and it is the king’s court.

verses.name: Amos 7:14
verses.text: Then answered Amos, and said to Amaziah, I was no prophet, neither was I a prophet’s son; but I was an herdman, and a gatherer of sycomore fruit:

verses.name: Amos 7:15
verses.text: And the Lord took me as I followed the flock, and the Lord said unto me, Go, prophesy unto my people Israel.

verses.name: Amos 7:16
verses.text: Now therefore hear thou the word of the Lord: Thou sayest, Prophesy not against Israel, and drop not thy word against the house of Isaac.

verses.name: Amos 7:17
verses.text: Therefore thus saith the Lord; Thy wife shall be an harlot in the city, and thy sons and thy daughters shall fall by the sword, and thy land shall be divided by line; and thou shalt die in a polluted land: and Israel shall surely go into captivity forth of his land.
